item.title: Upgradeable Contracts & More Fundraising for our NFT Promotions Ad Network

The post Upgradeable Contracts & More Fundraising for our NFT Promotions Ad Network appeared first on AlphaBack.
item.content:encoded:
We‚Äôre heads down building and fundraising for our NFT promotions ad network, so here‚Äôs another quick weekcap. But first a brief intro in case you‚Äôre new here:

AlphaBack is a browser extension that pays users to look at NFTs (ads), with the goal of building a DAO-owned ad network.

Also, we‚Äôre experimenting with a new section on these Retros called, Food for Thought. Review that (at the bottom of this note) if you want to go deeper.

Highlights

  • Fundraising. We closed three more angel investors on our SAFE!
  • Allocations. We‚Äôre now up to $965,000 in written commitments from investors. This is a 10% increase over last week.
  • Upgradeable Contracts. We‚Äòre laying the foundation for faster iterations and future flexibility via upgradeable contracts. We estimate releasing that code within 2 weeks.

Challenges

  • HackFS Hackathon. We had planned on participating in this hackathon, but prioritizing the release of the payments code meant that we didn‚Äôt have enough time for a meaningful submission.

How You Can Help

  • What do you think about DevCon in Bogot√°? We‚Äôre considering whether to sponsor a small booth there given the amount of foot traffic we can convert ‚Äì like we did at NFT NYC. Hit reply and send me your thoughts.
  • Here‚Äôs an updated list of investors who‚Äôd be interested in meeting us given their web3 thesis and portfolio. LMK if you have any connections with:
    • Jay Reinemann, Propel Venture Partners
    • David Waxman, TenOneTen Ventures
    • Evan Tana, Script Capital
    • Rich Robinson, Animoca Brands
    • Philipp Stauffer, FYRFLY Venture Partners
    • Jeffrey Haas, CoinSmart
    • Paul Veradittakit, Pantera Capital
    • Alex Atallah, Opensea Ventures
    • Kathryn Haun, Haun Ventures

Food for¬†Thought: NFT Promotions are hard.

NFT projects continue to sprout. There are now approximately 80,300 NFT collections on the Ethereum blockchain, up from 15,540 in 2021. And that doesn‚Äôt include the growing number of NFT projects on Solana. Importantly, marketing is a top expense for any NFT project.

A web3 marketing agency, Coinbound, says that ‚ÄúNFT marketing ranges from $10,000 to over $200,000 for a successful NFT marketing campaign.‚Äù According to another agency, ‚Äúestablished NFT brands can spend upwards of ‚Ç¨100,000+ monthly on their marketing to constantly reach out to new investors and broaden their reach. Start-up projects are recommended to have between ‚Ç¨10,000 and ‚Ç¨25,000 if they are really looking to expose their project to as many of the right eyes as possible.‚Äù Given the lack of better promotional alternatives, we believe this market is ripe and can produce meaningful revenue. This (partially) explains why we‚Äôre starting with promoting NFTs as a wedge into the broader advertising opportunity.

Below is a bottom-up calculation that illustrates the potential of the market. First, let‚Äôs determine the potential ad spend per year per project. Marketing budgets for traditional B2C companies typically range from 5 to 25 percent of a company‚Äôs revenue or revenue targets, depending on company size, stage of growth. One survey of SMBs suggests that companies earning less than $2M in revenue spend $14K in online marketing. While a 2019 survey suggests that SMB companies spend $10K‚Äì$50K in online advertising. Let‚Äôs assume that NFT projects have similar marketing spend, approximately $1.2K per month. That amount aligns with the marketing budgets suggested by web3 agencies for NFT projects (above).

Assuming there are 80,300 NFT collections, and they grow 30% YoY, then there may be 104K NFT projects by 2023. NFT collections follow power law distributions, so most of the projects will be small $1.2K/mo advertisers, while a few (1%) will be power users with larger budgets (e.g., 10x higher, as per the web3 agency example ranges above). Therefore, we calculate:

(99% * 104K projects * 1.2K/mo * 12 months) + 
(1% * 104K projects * 10.2K/mo * 12 months) = $1,609,920,000.

In the future, NFT projects will turn to trusted sources of quality advertising to reach broader yet targeted audiences, because the current alternatives are depressing ‚Äì from con artists, Discord shillers, to Twitter feeds littered with these giveaways:

Our goal is to attract enough users to download our extension, such that we can provide a welcome alternative to NFT collections who need to promote their projects.

The post Upgradeable Contracts & More Fundraising for our NFT Promotions Ad Network appeared first on AlphaBack.
